AWS is responsible for managing and patching the underlying infrastructure, including the firmware on the physical hosts that run EC2 instances.
Decoupling components ensures that failures in one part of the application do not cascade to others, improving fault tolerance and resilience.

A core reliability principle of the AWS Well-Architected Framework is the ability to recover from failure by automatically restoring services and resources.
The AWS Cloud allows customers to scale resources up or down on demand, eliminating the need to predict future capacity requirements.
AWS Lambda is a fully managed compute service that runs code without requiring customers to provision or manage servers.
The AWS Software Development Kit (SDK) allows developers to programmatically interact with AWS services from application code.
